welcomePage.title: Eclipse Colorer Plugin
welcomePage.intro: Thank you for installing Eclipse Colorer plugin.
welcomePage.item: Main Features Eclipse Colorer plugin uses Colorer-take5 library to introduce syntax highlighting support in great number of languages.

item.p: A window contains one or more perspectives. A perspective consists of views (e.g. Navigator) and editors for working with your resources. The shortcut bar at the far left of the window allows you to open new perspectives and move between perspectives that are already open. The perspective you are currently working with is shown in the title of the window and in the shortcut bar as a pushed-in icon.

welcomePage.item: Configuring your perspectives You can move views and editors around the workbench by dragging their titlebars. You can also add more views to your current perspective by using Window > Show View. To reset the perspective to its original state, choose Window > Reset Perspective. Once you have arranged your perspective, you can save it using Window > Save Perspective As.... You can customize the views, perspectives and New menu operations that show up for your perspective. To do this choose Window > Customize Perspective... . A view can additionally be converted into a Fast View by dragging it to the shortcut bar (at the far left of the window).
Learn more To learn more you can browse the Workbench User Guide.
